block.p: Barbara J. Rees and Tony David Fenner-Leitao were married yesterday by the Rev. Martin Crowe at the Roman Catholic Church of the Assumption in Cascais, Portugal.

The bride, 34, is a director of global marketing at Calvin Klein Cosmetics in New York. She graduated from the American University in Paris and received a master's degree in professional studies from Cornell. She is a daughter of Joan Rees of Bayhead, N.J., and the late John H. Rees. Her father retired as the president of the National Railway Utilization Corporation, a Philadelphia company that owned railroad tracks and made boxcars. Her mother, also retired, owned the Marlboro Inn, a bed-and-breakfast in Montclair, N.J.
Barbara J. Rees and Tony David Fenner-Leitao were married yesterday by the Rev. Martin Crowe at the Roman Catholic Church of the Assumption in Cascais, Portugal.

The bride, 34, is a director of global marketing at Calvin Klein Cosmetics in New York. She graduated from the American University in Paris and received a master's degree in professional studies from Cornell. She is a daughter of Joan Rees of Bayhead, N.J., and the late John H. Rees. Her father retired as the president of the National Railway Utilization Corporation, a Philadelphia company that owned railroad tracks and made boxcars. Her mother, also retired, owned the Marlboro Inn, a bed-and-breakfast in Montclair, N.J.

The bridegroom, 35, is a vice president for international equities at Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, the investment bank in New York. He graduated from Durham University in England and received an M.B.A. degree from the University of Chicago. He is a son of Sheilah Fenner-Leitao and Hernani Armenio de Almeida Leitao of Lisbon. His father, who is retired, was a textile importer and exporter in Lisbon. The bridegroom's mother teaches English at St. Julian's School, in Carcavelos, Portugal.
